Activity: Arrive at the office, check emails, and prioritize tasks based on urgency. Briefly read articles about project management on HBR.
Morning check-in: Review the progress from the previous day, identify any new roadblocks, and adjust the plan for the day. Communicate with @larch-1, @dsde-1, @qres-1, @sdev-1, @comp-1.
Deep work session: Focus on writing the executive summary for the project's final report. Review the structure and narrative of the report to ensure it's concise and impactful.

Coordinate communication between teams: Review the trading platform development status with the software development team (@larch-1, @sdev-1, @sdev-2) and the quantitative research team (@qres-1, @qres-2, @qres-3). Address any discrepancies or integration challenges.
Lunch Break. Order in and catch up on industry news.

Roadblock resolution: Spend the afternoon addressing any project roadblocks that have been reported. This may involve problem-solving sessions with individual team members or escalating issues to senior management. Communicate with the related members.
Review the completed tasks and update the project management software. Prepare a summary of progress to date for communication to the steering committee.
Address project roadblocks identified in the morning meetings. Collaborate with relevant team members to find solutions and implement corrective actions.
